intro: Rapanea pittieri var. chirripoensis, commonly known as the Chirripó rapanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Costa Rica, particularly in the Chirripó Mountains. This evergreen shrub or small tree typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high elevations. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and dark green, with a fragrant aroma typical of the Lauraceae family. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers followed by small, dark berries that are an important food source for local wildlife.
